CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles V. Johnson, 12 Chalfont Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "My candid opinion is that people give more recognition to the acquisition of money. It seems to be based on the reasoning that it is money that makes everything go around, and that is the more important end of that question."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles V. Johnson, wearing eyeglasses, light colored coat, light colored necktie with graphic pattern, and light colored hat with dark band, standing in front of Emma Jetticks Boot Shop window display, Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
